@graph.headline: Paneer tikka masala recipe | How to make paneer tikka masala (restaurant style)

@graph.name: swasthi
@graph.description: I’m Swasthi Shreekanth, the recipe developer, food photographer & food writer behind Swasthi's Recipes. My aim is to help you cook great Indian food with my time-tested recipes. After 2 decades of experience in practical Indian cooking I started this blog to help people cook better & more often at home. Whether you are a novice or an experienced cook I am sure Swasthi’s Recipes will assist you to enhance your cooking skills. Read more..

@graph.name: Paneer tikka masala recipe
@graph.description: Delicious paneer tikka masala prepared in restaurant style. This North Indian paneer tikka masala is rich, flavorful and great to serve on occasions with some paratha, naan or basmati rice.
recipeIngredient: ½ cup greek yogurt ((thick curd or hung curd) (refer notes))
1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste (or crushed ginger garlic)
¼ to ½ teaspoon red chili powder (or paprika (less spicy kind))
½ teaspoon garam masala (or tandoori masala)
1½ teaspoon ginger garlic paste (or crushed ginger garlic)
¾ to 1 teaspoon red chili powder ((or paprika) less spicy kind)

itemListElement.text: Firstly add ½ cup yogurt, ¼ to ½ teaspoon red chili powder, 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste, ½ teaspoon garam masala, ⅛ teaspoon turmeric & ¼ teaspoon salt to a mixing bowl.
itemListElement.name: Firstly add ½ cup yogurt, ¼ to ½ teaspoon red chili powder, 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste, ½ teaspoon garam masala, ⅛ teaspoon turmeric & ¼ teaspoon salt to a mixing bowl.

itemListElement.text: Mix well and taste test it. Add more salt if needed. Add paneer cubes & mix well to coat the marinade.
itemListElement.name: Mix well and taste test it. Add more salt if needed. Add paneer cubes & mix well to coat the marinade.

itemListElement.text: Optional - If using onions & bell peppers, then add ½ cubed onion layers & ½ cubed bell pepper and marinate well. Set this aside until the gravy is done.
itemListElement.name: Optional - If using onions & bell peppers, then add ½ cubed onion layers & ½ cubed bell pepper and marinate well. Set this aside until the gravy is done.

recipeInstructions.name: How to make paneer tikka masala

itemListElement.text: Heat 1 tablespoon oil and add 1 cup chopped onions. Saute them well until transparent or golden.
itemListElement.name: Heat 1 tablespoon oil and add 1 cup chopped onions. Saute them well until transparent or golden.

itemListElement.text: Add 1½ cup tomatoes, 14 cashews, 1 teaspoon sugar and ½ teaspoon salt. Saute all of these well until the tomatoes turn mushy and soft.
itemListElement.name: Add 1½ cup tomatoes, 14 cashews, 1 teaspoon sugar and ½ teaspoon salt. Saute all of these well until the tomatoes turn mushy and soft.

itemListElement.text: Then add ¾ to 1 teaspoon red chilli powder & ¾ to 1 teaspoon garam masala, Saute all of these for 2 mins, until the masala smells good & aromatic.
itemListElement.name: Then add ¾ to 1 teaspoon red chilli powder & ¾ to 1 teaspoon garam masala, Saute all of these for 2 mins, until the masala smells good & aromatic.

itemListElement.text: Cool this completely and add to a blender.  Pour ½ to ¾ cup water and blend to a smooth puree.
itemListElement.name: Cool this completely and add to a blender.  Pour ½ to ¾ cup water and blend to a smooth puree.

itemListElement.text: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Add 1½ teaspoon ginger garlic paste & saute for 1 to 2 mins, until the raw smell goes off.
itemListElement.name: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Add 1½ teaspoon ginger garlic paste & saute for 1 to 2 mins, until the raw smell goes off.

itemListElement.text: Lower the flame and add the onion tomato puree. (Careful as it may splash)
itemListElement.name: Lower the flame and add the onion tomato puree. (Careful as it may splash)

itemListElement.text: If needed you can optionally add more chilli powder to achieve a brighter color.
itemListElement.name: If needed you can optionally add more chilli powder to achieve a brighter color.

itemListElement.text: Pour ½ to ¾ cup water to bring this to a consistency.
itemListElement.name: Pour ½ to ¾ cup water to bring this to a consistency.

itemListElement.text: Cover and cook until the gravy turns thick and you see traces of oil on top.
itemListElement.name: Cover and cook until the gravy turns thick and you see traces of oil on top.

itemListElement.text: Crush the kasuri methi in your palms and sprinkle it. (optional)
itemListElement.name: Crush the kasuri methi in your palms and sprinkle it. (optional)

itemListElement.text: Taste the gravy & add more salt if needed. Rest this aside.
itemListElement.name: Taste the gravy & add more salt if needed. Rest this aside.

recipeInstructions.name: Making paneer tikka in oven or tawa

itemListElement.text: Option 1 - To make on griddle. Heat a tsp oil in a wide pan on a high flame, coat each paneer piece with the marinade & place on the griddle. Cook on a high flame till the marinade dries up and paneer turns golden. Similarly place the bell peppers and marinated onions and fry until the marinade dries up.
itemListElement.name: Option 1 - To make on griddle. Heat a tsp oil in a wide pan on a high flame, coat each paneer piece with the marinade & place on the griddle. Cook on a high flame till the marinade dries up and paneer turns golden. Similarly place the bell peppers and marinated onions and fry until the marinade dries up.

itemListElement.text: Option 2 - Grill in oven. Preheat the oven to 430 F or 220 C. Thread paneer, onion, bell pepper to a skewers. Then grill for 8 to 10 minutes on both sides until golden and crisp.
itemListElement.name: Option 2 - Grill in oven. Preheat the oven to 430 F or 220 C. Thread paneer, onion, bell pepper to a skewers. Then grill for 8 to 10 minutes on both sides until golden and crisp.

itemListElement.text: Option 3 - Air fryer. If your air fryer needs preheating, you may preheat it for 5 mins first. Thread paneer, onion, bell pepper to a skewers. Air fry the skewers placed in a tray at 390 F or 200 C for 5 mins. Brush them with the marinade and then air fry for another 2 mins. The marinade has to partially dry up. Also adjust the air fryer time as needed.
itemListElement.name: Option 3 - Air fryer. If your air fryer needs preheating, you may preheat it for 5 mins first. Thread paneer, onion, bell pepper to a skewers. Air fry the skewers placed in a tray at 390 F or 200 C for 5 mins. Brush them with the marinade and then air fry for another 2 mins. The marinade has to partially dry up. Also adjust the air fryer time as needed.

itemListElement.text: Transfer grilled paneer tikka along with veggies & onions to the tikka masala gravy.
itemListElement.name: Transfer grilled paneer tikka along with veggies & onions to the tikka masala gravy.

itemListElement.text: Pour the cream. Gently mix. Garnish with cream and coriander leaves.
itemListElement.name: Pour the cream. Gently mix. Garnish with cream and coriander leaves.

itemListElement.text: Serve paneer tikka masala with roti, butter naan or veg pulao.
itemListElement.name: Serve paneer tikka masala with roti, butter naan or veg pulao.
